title: Design Principles for authoritative
text: package two main functionalities: first relevant ecosystem R package analysis. provides functions parse extract information Author Authors@R fields DESCRIPTION second widely relevant, beyond specific case R package authors. provides general purpose functions deduplicate standardize author names.

title: Design Principles for authoritative
text: < Description scheme /conventions used naming functions arguments. can use prefix exported functions, name mould (“function named verb_object”), naming convention used throughout package. >

title: Design Principles for authoritative
text: < Describe data structures (.e. vectors, <data.frames> classes) given input key functions data structures functions return. design decisions around /O choices also mention enhances interoperability R packages pipelines (e.g. %>%). >

title: Design Principles for authoritative
text: < list bullet points explaining design decision reasoning. >

title: Parse and Deduplicate Author Names
text: authoritative provides functions clean authors names, focus context R package authors.

title: Parse and Deduplicate Author Names
text: can install stable version package CRAN: development version GitHub :

title: Parse and Deduplicate Author Names
text: examples illustrate current functionalities:
code: library(authoritative)  pkg_description <- system.file("DESCRIPTION", package = "authoritative") authors_r_pkg <- read.dcf(pkg_description, "Authors@R") parse_authors_r(authors_r_pkg) #> [[1]] #> [1] "Hugo Gruson <hugo@data.org> [aut, cre, cph] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4094-1476>)"

text: data.frame 5 variables: Package package name Version package version Authors@R authors listed Authors@R field DESCRIPTION file Author authors listed Author field DESCRIPTION file Maintainer package maintainer

title: Expand names from abbreviated forms or initials — expand_names
text: list xof abbreviated non-abbreviated names want deduplicate , function can used expand_names(x, x), return expanded version available x name

title: Expand names from abbreviated forms or initials — expand_names
code: expand_names(   c("W A Mozart", "Wolfgang Mozart", "Wolfgang A Mozart"),   "Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart" ) #> [1] "Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart" "Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart" #> [3] "Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart"

title: Parse the Author field from a DESCRIPTION file — parse_authors
text: character vector, list character vectors length equals length author_string

title: Parse the Author field from a DESCRIPTION file — parse_authors
code: # Read from a DESCRIPTION file directly utils_description <- system.file("DESCRIPTION", package = "utils") utils_authors <- read.dcf(utils_description, "Author")  parse_authors(utils_authors) #> [1] "R Core Team"            "contributors worldwide"  # Read from a database of CRAN metadata cran_epidemiology_packages$Author |>    parse_authors() |>    unlist() |>    unique() |>    sort() #>   [1] "A. what: Parse the Authors@R field from a DESCRIPTION file — parse_authors_r
title: Parse the Authors@R field from a DESCRIPTION file — parse_authors_r
text: Parse Authors@R field DESCRIPTION file person object

title: Parse the Authors@R field from a DESCRIPTION file — parse_authors_r
Parse the Authors@R field from a DESCRIPTION file — parse_authors_r
text: authors_r_string character containing Authors@R field DESCRIPTION file

title: Parse the Authors@R field from a DESCRIPTION file — parse_authors_r
text: person object, list person objects length equals length authors_r_string

title: Parse the Authors@R field from a DESCRIPTION file — parse_authors_r
code: # Read from a DESCRIPTION file directly pkg_description <- system.file("DESCRIPTION", package = "authoritative") authors_r_pkg <- read.dcf(pkg_description, "Authors@R")  parse_authors_r(authors_r_pkg) #> [[1]] #> [1] "Hugo Gruson <hugo@data.org> [aut, cre, cph] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4094-1476>)" #>   # Read from a database of CRAN metadata cran_epidemiology_packages |>    subset(!is.na(`Authors@R`), `Authors@R`, drop = TRUE) |>   parse_authors_r() |>    head() #> [[1]] #>  [1] "Thibaut Jombart [aut] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2226-8692>)"                          #>  [2] "Zhian N. Kamvar <zkamvar@gmail.com> [aut, cre] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1458-7108>)" #>  [3] "Caitlin Collins [ctb]"                                                                    #>  [4] "Roman Lustrik [ctb]"                                                                      #>  [5] "Marie-Pauline Beugin [ctb]"                                                               #>  [6] "Brian J. title: Remove content between brackets — remove_brackets
text: Remove content brackets

title: Remove content between brackets — remove_brackets
Remove content between brackets — remove_brackets
text: string character vector clean bracket Type bracket containing content remove. Must one "(" (default), "<", "["

title: Remove content between brackets — remove_brackets
text: character vector size string, elements stripped bracketted content.

title: Remove content between brackets — remove_brackets
code: remove_brackets(   "R source code is versioned with svn (and mirrored on GitHub)" ) #> [1] "R source code is versioned with svn "  remove_brackets(   c("r-project.org <https://r-project.org>", "python.org <https://python.org>"),   bracket = "<" ) #> [1] "r-project.org " "python.org "     remove_brackets(   "Content in square bracket [is removed] in the middle of a string",   bracket = "[" ) #> [1] "Content in square bracket  in the middle of a string"
